website_summaries.verdict: In terms of correction, reliability, expandability, and ease of use, this system tops the pack of competitors on our shortlist.
pros: Reliable and practical for most dog owners' needs
It is expandable and the transmitter is strong enough to cover up to 100 acres
cons: Some reports of receiver malfunctions and a few lemons

customer_reviews.title: The collar activated and didn't stop teasing my dog
customer_reviews.text: Just a few months after we purchased this product, and something went absolutely wrong. The other day, my dog tried to cross the boundary, the collar activated and it didn't stop. I was inside when I heard him screaming, and the screaming continued longer then usual. When I ran outside, my dog was in the garage still crying. I removed the collar quickly and that thing kept buzzing in my hand. What a horrific incident. I can't stop thinking about the pain and shock my dog felt. Now I don't even know if I can trust another product like this. We'll try to contact the company and hold them responsible for this. Don't buy this if you love your pet!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BM

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: After 2 1/2 months, the collar has disintegrated, and I am now having to purchase a new collar. The power cord falls out of the base at least once/week. Don't be fooled into thinking you are buying a more substantial product simply because the words "sport dog" are in the title.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Barely gives a warning before shocking the dog and is inconsistent with when it shocks. Sometimes it's close to the line and other times it's not even near the line. It doesn't even have a warning area. Just two beeps and then shocks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This invisible fence works great for my German Shepherd. Set up was easy to understand and everything seems weather proof. However, pay attention to the battery dying in the collar. It didn't seem to show me when it was almost dead and the dog figured it out because the beeps/shaking were lacking and left the yard. It would be nice if the main unit could have some feedback on the battery in the collar. However, would recommend if you want an invisible fence.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: Useless for Siberian Husky
customer_reviews.text: I have it for about 2 months My Husky goes right Through it Like its nothing Sometimes I see her sitting right by the wire Her Dog collar. Shakes but does not doi anything to her And of course the return window just closed So I’m stuck with it Useless useless useless
customer_reviews.author: piotr murat

customer_reviews.title: Works on Great Dane and Newfoundland
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to install and works great. It’s winter and our ground is frozen so it’s above ground right now. I had to shave the Newfy’s neck for him to feel it. We have it on the lowest setting the one for a 12 pound dog and they yelped when they crossed(1 time)They then stopped wanting to go outside. So be careful I think they are kinda wimps because I tested it on me first it hurt but not that bad. Anyway now I don’t even need to put the colliers on they stay in the yard. We just moved and they are both 12years old. Dane is 115lbs Newf 145lbs.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: This is a lot of work but big savings.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Took 3 days to install. Buy pre twisted wire. Using a drill will help though. Rent a small machine to bury the wires. Order a surge protector. I called then several times for ideas and help. They were always helpful! I ordered a collar for my little guy too and they helped me with that. Good deal but does take some work. Even with the fence my dog rosie still loves the mulch. And yes the company sold me the power safe brand collar for the little guy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Aponte

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought and installed this product, purchased another collar since I have 2 dogs. The collars are set to the same settings and they aren’t shocking at the same distance from the wire. I can’t set the flags at 2 different places as this would only confuse them and for training this does not work. Even at the lowest sensitivity they are shocked about 4 feet in from the wire which takes away from how much of the yard they can use. I’m unsure if I can switch the collars out for new ones, make a return, or how to resolve this issue. Unhappy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Humphreys

customer_reviews.title: Requires extensive training over two weeks to train each dog!
customer_reviews.text: The description says it includes "training tips". What it doesn't say is that there's a two week training period where they recommend you spend a good bit of time with your dog every day. Also, the manual says the dog can't wear the collar 24x7. Which means you are relying on the training after that, or removing and replacing the collar every day. That's not a workable solution for us, so I just returned it and replaced it with a full time Fi Shock hot wire. From previous experience, this requires no training of your dog. They touch it once, get zapped, and never go near it again. Sometimes simpler is better.
customer_reviews.author: DanC

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: We can’t get it to work when testing it won’t stop beeping no matter where in the area we are tried it on dog and it zapped him immediately we’ve tried everything we can think of and it won’t work
customer_reviews.author: Cytheria

customer_reviews.title: Great system
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect solution for a wandering dog. My dog was already familiar with a training collar that vibrated, toned,or shocked so it took maybe 3 times of testing the boundaries so quit leaving the yard. Installing took a bit due to the size of the yard and using a shovel for the line insertion but wasn’t hard. I had to do the double wire thing because we only did our back yard. The electrical set up was simple and I was able to buy more wire at Lowe’s when I ran out. This works without a hitch and cost 1100 dollars less than my quote from an in ground fence installer.
customer_reviews.author: jay davis

customer_reviews.title: Only half the wire came with the 1000' kit
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 1000' wire kit and only came with 500'.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Horstman

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and do not last...
customer_reviews.text: Correction to my first review. I've had 3 failures. Looking through my records, I had one other fail within the warranty period that was replaced. My second SportDOG transmitter just failed. They are expensive, not worth the money and only last 2-3 years. Mine were protected in a closet with no reason for failure other than the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: Bad power connecting
customer_reviews.text: Power supply would not stay plugged onto unit. Prongs bent after having to plug it in multiple time so I didn't even get to use it. Bad power connecting. It's like an s-video plug.
customer_reviews.author: S. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The product works well and accomplishes what we need it to. My review is based on the excellent customer service that we've received. We ordered the receiver collar, which broke after about a year. SportDog replaced it because it was under warranty. 3 years later, the receive collar broke again (without anything other than normal usage). Although it is out of warranty, SportDog is still us a new receiver collar free of charge. I appreciate a Company who stands behind their product and replaces it when it has not been improperly used (or abused). Plus, the email exchange with SportDog customer service to resolve this issue was less than 24 hrs. Exceptional!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fence for our new rescued Beagle Springer mix. I recommend getting an edger to dig your wire trench because it’s just time consuming and painful when your middle aged but the system works awesome once you have it installed. My transmitter was defective and the company immediately sent me a replacement. All material is top quality. Worth the money if you want to keep your pet in your yard.
customer_reviews.author: stalbot41473

customer_reviews.title: This has been a good investment for my dog
customer_reviews.text: This has been a good investment for my dog. She is a 18lb puppy and has learned to stay inside the boundary very very fast. I bought the trainer well worth the extra dollars for the hand transmitter for training. My puppy was good after two days. I have even placed flags where the is no fence and she stays away from the marked flags. My puppy has ran through a few times but only when she was very excited and did not notice she was near the boundary. Was very easy to install. You can rent trenchers just for low voltage wire at home depot.
customer_reviews.author: rgm

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised only 1 con
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Purchased separate 14 gauge wire, glad I did. Previous home had in ground fence with 20 gauge wire which I easily cut on several occasions. Collars have only been charged once and we are two weeks in. Training and correction zones work as advertised. Purchased extra collar fir second dog. Laborious to put in bit saved a bunch of money doing it myself. Only con is that both collars have had prongs fall out. In 24 hours we lost 3 short prongs coincidentally. So, check your prongs frequently. Would buy this product again no doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Vad

customer_reviews.title: Great...when it works....which isn't long
customer_reviews.text: Great when working- but does not last long. My first one the box died within 6 months ( I only used it on weekends for about 3 of the 6 months) and would not return after this amount of time. It worked so well when it worked that I did order another with the hopes that it was just a fluke....well here I am on my second box and only 6 weeks and it is not working (again only use on weekends up at our cabin). It is too bad as this is an expensive unit.
customer_reviews.author: ringak

customer_reviews.title: Strong customer support...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good company and a good product. Customer service was excellent when I had an issue. Wish it was American made, but the customer service is definitely American. My strong recommendation is that you buy their surge protector, which you can only buy over the phone, for whatever reason. Lightning can travel up the wire and even a regular surge protector won't protect. I don't know why they don't promote their surge protector more actively. Other than that, this is an effective product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic dog fence
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic dog fence. Works as advertised. Great range and adjustability. The build quality of the materials is great as well. I've owned for several months. I have approximately 2 acres of electronically fenced in property. After a few days of training my dog he no longer crossed the border outline. I can now let him loose in the yard anytime day or night and he will stay in the yard. Even without the shock collar, he will Not leave the yard. This product saved me over 20k in traditional fencing material. No issues, very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: We have had an excellent with this product. Our lab is almost 2 now and I didn’t think anything would keep her in the yard. She broke multiple leashes, runs and collars so my expectation was low that a system $1000 cheaper than our local installer would work. Our pup has never broke through the barrier line. Installation could be a pain, but we used an electric sidewalk trimmer to dig the trench line which took hours off of installation. My biggest concern going in was would it hold up to a VT winter, which it did! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Busy mom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - this fence saved my sanity!!!
customer_reviews.text: After months of reading reviews and being on the "fence" about getting one of these, I finally decided to try it out. I am so glad I did. This thing has saved my sanity. I have a 125 lb German Shepherd puppy and he is STUBBORN. I honestly didn't think it would work on him. However, it works great. Now, I don't have to worry about him being outside and deciding to run off. Best investment in a long time!!!!
customer_reviews.author: jmzsmom

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I use this collar for my Sheltie that has very long hair. The collar has long and short prongs. With his old collar the prongs would get caught in his fur. That doesn't happen with the sport dog collar. The battery lasts a long time and it's nice to have the remote when we are away from the yard. It is a great designed product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy the rechargeable collar instead of the battery. Better collars.
customer_reviews.text: I love this system for the price. This is my 2nd one and I have no interest in switching brands. The new rechargeable collar is nice and lasts a long time. It does take a while to recharge when you need to so do it overnight. Only complaint is the old battery collars so not work with the new rechargeable system I bought. Not really a big deal but I thought I'd have extra collars. They use to break after a while anyways but I attribute it to the screws most likely being over tightened.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Rip off
customer_reviews.text: Would give it no stars spent all that money to get half the set up advertised Add said 1000’ feet We got 500’ feet of wire
customer_reviews.author: Misti Kiser

customer_reviews.title: Unit installed quickly with a edger attachment for the weed ...
customer_reviews.text: Unit installed quickly with a edger attachment for the weed wacker. It took us about 5 hours to install about 900 feet of wire and place flags and that was going through 2 gravel driveways. Took about 20 minutes to install the wall unit and set up collar. We watched a few youtube videos on training and to be honest our 6 month old golden learned quick even on the lowest correction. Its about day 5 and she will stop just a few feet short of the flags and is no longer running in the road to greet our neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Rikki

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This product was fairly easy to install. Besides coming with a complete book of instructions there are countless videos online to help. We installed this for our 70 lbs lab pit mix. He liked to bolt through our fenced in yard (chain link fence) whenever he saw a squirrel or another dog. We wrapped the wire through the fence and it's worked great for him/us so far. Training is more difficult but dogs are generally fast learners so that does not seem to be a problem yet either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as described!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I can use this! After installation, I took my dog out to test boundaries, and once we got close to flags, she ran towards them causing her to get shocked! I had it set on 4, as she is a big dog and a little stubborn. It broke my heart to see her in shock and pain! I know I can reduce the setting, but I don't know if she will stay within the confines. The problem IS NOT with the unit, it is both myself AND my dog.
customer_reviews.author: MikeT

customer_reviews.title: Overall, I'm happy
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use the supplied wire. Instead I bought some thicker stuff because I didn't want to have to run wire more than once. So far, after several months, everything is still good. It hasn't been through a freeze/thaw cycle yet though. The unit does its job and is easy to use. I wish they would have included a lightning breaker thing along with it though and maybe some pre-twisted wire to reach from the outlet to the unit itself. Overall it was pretty easy to set up and works well for my two dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P.

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical as to how easy this would be to install and how well it would work. I am pleasantly surprised with both. We rented a machine to lay the wire in the ground and that worked out well. It cut through roots and laid the wire in about 4” deep. We bought a smaller collar for our 18lb one year old dog. We took our time and had to gradually increase the collar to level 4 for it to work. She now knows her boundaries and it enables us to all enjoy the yard this summer. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I recommend using a cable trencher that ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I recommend using a cable trencher that will bury the line as you dig--saved a lot of time! Also, be sure to plan your perimeter before digging--again this will save you time and cussing. Last, be sure to spend a lot of time training with your dog. It will pay dividends if you do so. I have a weim and was not sure if the system would work for him. However this product has been awesome so far. Thanks Sportdog!
customer_reviews.author: Scott W.

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever! My wife and I installed the electric fence around our 3 acre property in a day (with the help of a trencher). However, we didn't use the wire provided, we bought heavy duty wire instead, just to be safe. We have a husky and a toy fox terrier who both wear these collars every time they go out. Every time they hit the electric fence, they instantly run back. Only took about a week for them to learn. We haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bryson

customer_reviews.title: Great brand for electric fence
customer_reviews.text: Install was easy and came with everything we needed. Only regret is not buying the rechargeable collar. The battery it came with died pretty quick after putting all the flags up. Also the collar was way to heavy and bulky for our 20 pound dog. I called Sports Dog directly and purchased the rechargeable collar which is much lighter and more convenient. I'm so glad we put this fence in.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Moehlman

customer_reviews.title: Bought this 3 times
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic. I’ve purchased three of them because the first two stopped working due to lightning. I’m going to use a dog fence surge protector this time, but it’s hard to fault the unit for lightning. I’ve been using this for several years my dog respects it it’s easy to train them it’s easy to install and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: belzerker

customer_reviews.title: Happy until collar broke
customer_reviews.text: I was originally really happy with this system. We had it installed and trained our dog and she responded well. Until... the bulky collar snagged on the deck and caused her to break her toe. $600 in vet bills later, we called the company hoping they would at least replace the collar and we were told since it wasn't a manufacturer's defect, it wasn't covered. I get that it was a weird accident, but still thought we would get a better response from the company or, at a minimum, a discount on another collar that caused the broken toe.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole J

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this device
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this device, works amazing as long as you properly train your dog (everyone I've heard who hasn't had success did not go through the training regimen - the danger is if your dog figures out the shock stops when they get past the barrier). We had to buy extra wire (fenced about 2 acres) and did not bury it yet but it seems fine laying on the ground. Our dog chewed the plastic collar when it was off but the device can be attached to a regular collar if you drill a few holes in it. Fantastic product, a total lifesaver for us.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Owen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Both of my dogs ran right through the electric fence while being shocked one whining the other ran start for her bed. They knew they did wrong but still crossed over
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Good contain but no training
customer_reviews.text: The contain feature works well we bought 2 additional collars for a 3 dog system and upgraded the wire to 14ga and it hold 2 lab mixes and a dane mix just fine. The train feature is a joke the remote doesn't work with any collar 75% of the time and only 1 collar about half the time. When it does work it has about a 2p-30 ft range and the remote battery life is laughable at best
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Davis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to keep our dog in our yard
customer_reviews.text: We do not have a gated fence and hating making out dog stay in a kennel for 10 hours a day while we were at work. This was super easy to install and one zap stepping out of bounds and she no longer will even get anywhere near those white flags. We leave her outside to roam throughout the front and back yard during the day and this has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Sport dog invisible fence had been a life saver. We have 2 labradors - one WAS a runner and the other hasn’t known life with out it. Both dogs respect it and don’t cross the line even when not wearing the collars. The only reason I gave it less stars on installation is because our acreage is pretty rocky, therefore challenging. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: justme

customer_reviews.title: Overall GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this system after our the internal battery in the collar for our previous system died. I decided to increase the boundary area and the installation was very easy. we have a smaller medium dog (30lbs) and I was worried about the size of the module on the collar, but it is very light and she doesn't mind it at all. After having the system for just under a year we adopted another dog and pick up another collar and it also works with out any issues. Great system for multiple dogs. The battery life is great haven't had to change it yet but unlike some of the other collars it will be replaceable when the time comes!
customer_reviews.author: James W Feltz

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Even though we have a fence the front is only 4 feet high due to township laws. I was afraid my dog would jump it so we installed this as an added safety feature. It tools is about a day to install. I just an edge cutter to cut a line around the property and placed the wire in it. It wasn’t too hard to install
customer_reviews.author: Nicole H.

customer_reviews.title: Unit setup and establishing boundaries with the flags was simple ...
customer_reviews.text: Unit setup and establishing boundaries with the flags was simple. Even though I only have an acre lot, it would only work on "high", indicating that the loop was broken on the lower setting. Increasing the boundary warning resulted in spontaneous corrections in all areas within the boundary and decreasing the boundary warning resulted in no correction at all.
customer_reviews.author: JNR

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product and a wonderful company!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product! Works perfectly, easy to train my dogs to the system, easy to set-up and use! I did have an issue with 1 collar not working 6 months after purchase. I called customer service and they sent out a new collar the same day with no hassle and without wasting my time through a whole diagnostic process! Also, the customer service representative spoke plain English and easy to understand and very nice! There was also no automated phone system to navigate! Wonderful product and a wonderful company! I have another training collar from sport dog and it works wonderfully as well! I highly recommend all sport dog products!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: I personally have been pleased with the performance and value thus far
customer_reviews.text: I do not rate every product, but I feel that this purchase deserves one. If installed correctly, this product does what it is designed to do. No underground fence system can replace the security of a traditional fence. However, in my short experience it seems that SportDOG has done a remarkable job with this product because it keeps our dog contained while under our intermittent supervision. Again, an underground fence cannot guarantee containment and buyers should anticipate that training will be required with respect to the differences of each individual dog. I personally have been pleased with the performance and value thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with the collar I ordered where the battery wasn't holding a charge as it should. It took me about 5 minutes for them to resolve the issue and send me a new one. The product was easy to install and works great, it says to take 10 days to adjust the dog to the system, but mine figured it out immediately after the first time he got a shock. Would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: This fence works perfectly. So easy to install. It took less than 2 hours to do 1 acre, not counting the areas burying the wire. The wire can be zip tied to a fence. My dog never slips under the fence and has full range of the yard. The dog figured it out after the first day and there was no need for weeks of training.
customer_reviews.author: DMc

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to install. Worked right away. I called their customer service twice with questions before I got started and both times it was easy to reach someone and they knew everything. I recommend taking the time to test the boundary before using with a dog to make sure you get the right amount of warning space before the correction. Transmitter is incredibly straight forward to set and I like that we can set it to vibrate only. After the first serious correction our dogs now hear the beep and jump back!
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: Replace the wire with thicker wire if you can.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great solution to a frustrating problem. The biggest downside is the wire that comes with the system isn't a heavy gauge and doesn't have substantial insulation. My best guess is that the supplied wire is only a temporary install in my application and I will be replacing it in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: I will buy again if I move.  Thanks for a good product!
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best purchases we've ever made. We can let our dog out and not worry. One collar failed, called the company and real live English speaking person answered the phone. She had me test one thing while I was on the phone, and the said they would ship a replacement. Very refreshing to get good service. I'm not sure how they do it, but the batteries in the collars last an insane length of time (six months to a year, maybe longer). Installation can be a pain, but you'll be glad in the long run. If we move, I wouldn't hesitate to order another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hall

customer_reviews.title: My dog learned the boundaries after just 1 week.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a month now and so far it's worked perfectly. I haven't had any dead spots or gaps at all. Very easy to setup. The only problem I noticed is the instructions aren't clear on how to determine the warning zone. It doesn't explain what distance each number is so you have to do a trial and error.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Medley

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Self installed, a lot of effort, but not very complicated. System working like a charm right out of the box. Rented an edger/cable layer from local hardware store and took about 6 hrs for 1 acre.
customer_reviews.author: A. Martelli

customer_reviews.title: customer service from SportDog
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this system 2012 and it worked fine until lightning damaged my wall unit beyond repair. I called the company to see how much replacement for the main unit would be and was pleasantly surprised at my treatment by customer service. They assured me that it was warranteed for 24 months and would quickly send a new unit with a post paid return box for the damaged one. I also bought a surge protector designed for electric inground fence. My customer service rep was courteous and professional. It is good to do business with this company!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Mccormack

customer_reviews.title: This system has worked really well for our Great Pyrenees who discovered she could clear our 4-foot fence ...
customer_reviews.text: This system has worked really well for our Great Pyrenees who discovered she could clear our 4-foot fence with ease. We set the zone wide at first, and then narrowed it to about three feet. It has been a perfect solution for our backyard escape artist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The installation was tedious and long because we started using the wrong tools
customer_reviews.text: The system works perfectly. My dogs got shocked once and they learned quickly where the boundary was. The installation was tedious and long because we started using the wrong tools. If you can, seriously buy a trencher and let it do all of the hard work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Maybe good for a huge yard, but not effective enough in a smaller back yard.
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty easy to install, as I used my edger, to dig a small trench for the wire. Ultimately, it just wasn’t effective enough for my residential yard to keep my lab. Update: lab easily jumps the fence now. This thing is useless
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Battery life light
customer_reviews.text: Would be nice to have a battery life light on collar
customer_reviews.author: terryT

customer_reviews.title: Great system!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my stubborn lab. He learned the boundaries very quickly. The collar is very big so it will fit larger dogs. It's nice go be able to use standard 9 volt batteries. I would recommend purchasing a stronger wire, such as 14 gauge. The 20 gauge that comes with it will work, but probably won't last very long in the weather. So far I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie N.

customer_reviews.title: Refund?
customer_reviews.text: Product did not function properly since 8/28/2018 purchase. Collar randomly corrected dog or inaccurately at first, now it doesn't shock at all. Outside of return period although I'd like a refund since I was unable to troubleshoot the system due to time constraints and needing to order a new tester strip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing items
customer_reviews.text: Our box came with no wore or power adapter. Sport dog sent them to us as Amazon would not fix the problem
customer_reviews.author: jvoerste

customer_reviews.title: This was a replacement fence for one that was hit ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement fence for one that was hit by lightning. I would never be without this fence again!!! Our lab is able to run free, yet has boundaries to protect him. Anyone who has pets should care enough to protect them from being hit by a car. We we actually replacing the electric box, but decided on the whole kit in case we decide to adopt another dog.
customer_reviews.author: dhudson

customer_reviews.title: Dog learned quickly!
customer_reviews.text: It took a while to install as we had to rent equipment to bury the line. Our dog learned to quickly stay in the fenced area! I don't know why, but every once in a while the machine will have a constant beep due to a break in the wiring. I have not been able to fix this. I don't know if it's equipment problem or installation problem. I would recommend this product for someone looking for an invisible fence.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS

customer_reviews.title: Necessary Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I used a cable barrier to install and it took me about 4 hours to install about 4 acres of line. It has completely stopped our bull-headed Rhodesian Ridgeback from leaving the yard. Training was fairly straight forward and we were able to remove the flags after about a month. 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Almanza

customer_reviews.title: Good system, keeps the dog in our yard
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and use, have been using for several months now....keeps our dog in the yard, even when tempted by dogs walking by in the street.
customer_reviews.author: E E

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a female pitbull that will dog out once in awhile. They have one fully fenced acre to run so can't always keep an eye on her. I have lined the bottom of fence with chicken wire three feet out. Hot wire on top. Still couldn't keep her in. Bought this did the training. Now she won't go within ten feet of the fence. Even without the collar. Awesome .
customer_reviews.author: Alexa B

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent warning zone
customer_reviews.text: Great product and it has been a life saver for our dogs. My one issue (why I gave 4 stars) is because the distance of the “warning zone”, where the collar beeps before the shock, is pretty inconsistent within about 6 inches. This makes it a bit difficult to train the dog, but my dogs have learned that they just don’t go near that area, rather than learning that they can go up to the line of flags. Otherwise a great product
customer_reviews.author: Kasi

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. PERFECT for large and small dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This system is perfect. I have ano adult German Shepherd and a Mastiff Mix puppy. My yard is over a half acre and is completely fenced in. I purchased this to keep the dogs from jumping on the fence and away from the driveway double gate. My dogs learned their boundaries quickly and now they don't test their limits. I would highly recommend this to anyone with dogs. This product was fairly easy to install and the collar uses standard 9v batteries. I can't say enough positive things about this DIY system
customer_reviews.author: CableGuy11605

customer_reviews.title: Expensive - did not work
customer_reviews.text: This fence did not work as well as we had hoped. We bought it for our uncle and his dogs and it took a long time to get it in the ground. After all that effort it was dissapointing that the fence did not work on all spots. His dogs needed to get regular shock collars instead.
customer_reviews.author: Ogren‘s

customer_reviews.title: ... system for a year now and we would totally recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.text: We've had this system for a year now and we would totally recommend to anyone. We have 4 medium sized dogs that kept escaping from our yard..... we've got 10 fenced acres but they insisted on chasing cows. After just a few days of training with the new collars, our dogs all learned the fence was the stopping point. The SportDog company has been great! One of the probes on the receivers broke and was not covered by warranty but SportDog sent us a free and new receiver anyways as a courtesy. I will continue to buy from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to set up. We ran it along the outside of 4-rail fence that surrounds property. We only buried it where it crosses the driveway. The Dogs learned very quickly to not leave but 1 of them learned if it bolts across the driveway it can escape. Once we get our gates up it will solve that problem. We also put the wire that crosses the driveway 5 feet further out because the metal gates will affect it when it's too close. I can walk across the road and the dogs (5 of them) will stop and wait at the line. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: AngelGina

customer_reviews.title: I used to be able to keep the dogs a good 5-6' away from the perimeter
customer_reviews.text: I have had this system installed in-ground for a year and it has done the job by keeping the dogs in the yard. I have noticed the range has decreased significantly. I used to be able to keep the dogs a good 5-6' away from the perimeter, but not they have to get right on the wire before a correction is triggered.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product to anyone for the money that it ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my labs who currently have about 3 acres of land to run on. BOTH collars broke ( the two pieces that screw together broke) within owning this system for 6 months, I would not recommend this product to anyone for the money that it cost. extremely disappointed! i will be contacting the company and will post a follow up.
customer_reviews.author: JAY

customer_reviews.title: I like the system but a couple of issues
customer_reviews.text: I like the system but a couple of issues. A bit of work to install around my 3/4 acre property but overall works well. One issue is the collar. The plastic collar with long belt fastener is not great. I would prefer an adjustable canvas collar that is easy to snap on and off (my sister's system for her dogs has this). In addition, the boundary area seems to 'shift'; even though I didn't change the setting, the boundary area changes from 1 foot to 3 or 4 feet. Tough to train the dog when the collar doesn't go off as expected at the flag. Will continue to work with it but still training...
customer_reviews.author: ScituateBP

customer_reviews.title: Trained my dog in two days....
customer_reviews.text: ....and so far he has not left the property. If you are not willing to spend the time training your dog (and your family) this system then don't spend the money. You have to be dedicated to training if you want results!
customer_reviews.author: William J Herrick

customer_reviews.title: Happy Black Lab and happy dad
customer_reviews.text: I did not use the supplied wire. I used a much thicker/heavier gauge. Yard size is 1.5 acres, so I rented the "electric fence trenching tool" from the local Rentals Unlimited. I'm not sure what this tool is actually called, but that is what I requested and the kid working there knew what I wanted. I've had the fence for over a year and have had no problems. I have not even had to replace the battery in the collar. Happy Black Lab and happy dad.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth jefferson

customer_reviews.title: This fence is the best investment I've spent for my 40lb pitty rescue
customer_reviews.text: This fence is the best investment I've spent for my 40lb pitty rescue! She loves to be able to run in our yard freely (and get in our creek as the collar is waterproof). And it is great to watch the kids play with her too! She was trained within a week!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional product!
customer_reviews.text: Installed this around our home, using about 550ft of wire. Has worked flawlessly! Even ordered a second collar - adjusting them independently is a snap! Highly recommend! Also, I purchased a specific surge protector that also connects and protects the paremiter wire - did this after reading horror stories about fried systems.
customer_reviews.author: Mxmumpwr

customer_reviews.title: Best choice on the market and I have owned several.
customer_reviews.text: This product was a life saver. I had another, very expensive electric fence and my dog got out repeatedly and got hit. When my children wanted another dog, I knew it was not an option until we got a better fense. This fence costed less and works better. It has a variety of settings and allows for complete personalization of your system. Great Quality, Great customer service if you have questions. I would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Sportdog, defective collars. Stay way
customer_reviews.text: The receiver was exchanged once, three collars were exchanged too and still not working except a few hours for one colar. A professional set up the wire, called sportdog but nothing came out. This professional told me that collars are defective. Stay away from sportdog. They mislead you until you can not return the product. Bad product and business
customer_reviews.author: christian

customer_reviews.title: Wish i wouldve bought tgis a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: So far, (just set it up today) this product is awesome. All three of my dogs are like Houdini, multiple neighbors have threatened to shoot them due to their livestock being in their fields. I've tried everything to keep them on my property. And THIS PRODUCT has already gotten them worried about trying to escape. 5 star forsure.
customer_reviews.author: landon Michael Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Customer service was excellent in helping me design my layout and figure the ...
customer_reviews.text: I enclosed about 20 acres of our property with the system with part of it being underground but most attached to existing perimeter fencing. Customer service was excellent in helping me design my layout and figure the best method for installation. Though my install was long and tedious because of the amount of land, the actual hook up to the base unit and the rest of the install were simple. The system has only been working for about 3 weeks but so far I am very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Farm Girl

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up I love it
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased another brand from Amazon, it was poorly built.. I decided to try this one. This one is very high quality. Worked so well exceeding my expectation. Very easy to set up I love it!! Dont waste your time to try other brands on amazon, this one should be the one you want. You will not get disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: Andy M

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing
customer_reviews.text: We have a 60 pound Pitbull mix who was constantly escaping through holes in our fence. She actually had police surveillance on her and the sheriff's department was just waiting to put her down. We bought this fence system and installed it in about an hour around the entire yard. We followed the instructions for training the dog and after being shocked twice, she knew where the boundaries were and absolutely would not cross them. I should say this works well for us because we have a fence around the yard and the dog cannot get a running start at the boundary. It has however worked miraculously well at keeping our dog from breaking through the fence.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I enclosed about an acre and pit my terminal in a setached garage. My gsp did get shocked a couple times but learned quickly with border walks and now respects his boundries. I also have a remote sportdog system for walks and hunting and he learned to know the difference. I reccomend this system
customer_reviews.author: Short hair pointer

customer_reviews.title: Collar is bulky for smaller dog. My dog is ...
customer_reviews.text: Collar is bulky for smaller dog. My dog is 46 lbs and I think it's a little bulky but he doesn't seem to mind. Quick installation with mini trencher- husband and helper were done in 2 hrs. 1/3 acre lot. Didn't need extra wire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The remote works great! Installing the boundary wire was a little work! Following the training instructions is a must as long as you follow it this is a great product
customer_reviews.author: Rogue

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and very effective
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Burying the line is not necessary if a fence already exists. Simply secure the line to the fence and you’re good to go. Our dog quickly learned the beep/vibration with the following “static correction” aka shock. Within a week she had tested her boundaries and avoids the fencing
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent
customer_reviews.text: We have had 2 acres fenced with this system for the last 3 years. It has never failed us. Worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: Blue Panda

customer_reviews.title: Gold
customer_reviews.text: I keep 14 dogs in an acre this way. It worked so well some dogs do not even need the collar they just respect the boundaries. This one is the only one that allows you as many collars as you want. Which is a big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: SGT HAMMER TIME

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, easy fence
customer_reviews.text: This fence is perfect for a wild young lab. Two zaps and he now knows where he cannot go. Pay attention to how to train the dogs with the white flags and you will have a good dog in a week. I searched and searched for other brands and saw this one at a friends. After seeing it, I bought one too and it is more
customer_reviews.author: Dale Riviere

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: Love this system! I just moved out of my parents with my 3 year old husky. They bought the system years ago for another dog and we taught him when we adopted him. I just bought it again for my house and absolutely love it! I like that I can control the range and intensity.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised
customer_reviews.text: This containment system has worked well so far for our 60lb lab/shepherd mix. She only got out twice during the training period. Once because my kid crossed the boundary and another time to chase a squirrel. Hasn’t challenged it again since. It takes some effort on the front end to set up but is worth it for t he price. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Wes R.

customer_reviews.title: No more roaming dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! We have 10 acres and needed a system that could handle enclosing a good portion of our property. We purchased additional wire to give our Great Pyrenees space to stay near our goats and to keep them from roaming and this did the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Cummins

customer_reviews.title: it seemed like a good distance (kicked on about 1-2 feet away)
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading the wire really isn't necessary for a typical suburban home. Be careful on the initial range settings though... I tested my perimeter with a setting of 5 by walking around with the collar in my hand and listening for the beep... it seemed like a good distance (kicked on about 1-2 feet away), but when I put the collar on my dog, she got jolted about 5 feet away from the line... took a few weeks to make her unafraid of the grass at all. You really want to crank the range setting lower than you'd thin (mine is set close to zero and still very effective).
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Seabury

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem in one day!
customer_reviews.text: My Vizsla was jumping a 7 ft block wall. I have a large back yard so it didn't make sense to try to make my yard look like a compound with 10 ft wall. So I installed this and I no longer have an problem!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce R. Burnham

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stop a do
customer_reviews.text: When it decides to work it great...However if your dog wants out they just have to run through since they won’t get shocked once outside the set range, then get shocked trying to get back in and that’s only if it decides to go off in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: casing cracked
customer_reviews.text: Only problem is that the corner broke off and water seeped in. The connections corroded. I need to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all!!! We were so excited to get this product so our dog can roam free during the day.....we have lost him twice!!! Thank God nice people found him!! Other than that he gets out anytime we try it.....it worked for about 2 weeks.....after that.....awful!!! 😒 What a waste of money......😔😒 We have changed batteries, turned voltage up and down.....we follow directions to a T and it just doesn't work!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: Support was amazing on how they handle the situation I was very ...
customer_reviews.text: Had this installed for about 2 months. My Female Labrador learned quick and she stays in the yard. I went on vacation last week and had someone watching the house. I forgot to inform them that if it thunder storms to unplug the transmitter. Well lightning hit and transmitter was no longer working when I got home. I called SportsDog support and they walked me through everything to try and fix it but nothing worked. I was still under warrantee so they are sending me out a new transmitter. Support was amazing on how they handle the situation I was very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

product_meta.title: SportDOG Brand In-Ground Fence Systems – from the Parent Company of INVISIBLE FENCE Brand - Underground Wire Electric Fence - Tone, Vibration, & Static - 100 Acre Capability - Remote Trainer Option
product_meta.description:
Style:Containment System

The SportDOG Brand In-Ground Fence system is a simple and cost-effective alternative to a traditional fence.1,000 feet of wire, 100 flags, 1 Transmitter, and 1 Collar Receiver are included to keep your dog contained in a yard up to 1 1/3 acres. The Transmitter is powerful enough to cover up to 100 acres of land with the purchase of additional Wire & Flag Kits (SDF-WF), and you can add an unlimited number of dogs with the purchase of additional Add-A-Dog Collar Receivers (SDF-R). Installation is as simple as burying the wire around the perimeter of your yard and plugging in the Transmitter. The Collar Receiver offers 4 levels of static stimulation to match any dogs' temperament, as well as a vibration/tone option.

In-Ground Fence system Features:

 * 4 levels of static stimulation with vibrate (buzz)/ tone (beep) warning
 * Kit includes 1000 ft of wire, 100 flags and 2 splice kits: enough to contain 1 1/3 acre
 * Contain up to 100 acres with additional wire and flags (SDF-WF)
 * Collar is waterproof
 * For dogs 10 lb. or larger
 * Collar take standard 9-volt battery that lasts 6-12 months
 * Fence transmitter features wire break alarm to alert you to potential problems with the boundary wire
 * Built in lightening protection
 * Contain an unlimited number of dogs with additional collars (SDF-R)
 * Hidden fence for your dog(s) with underground wire; invisible to neighbors
 * Anti-linger feature prevents dogs from standing in the warning zone to drain the collar battery
 * 2-year manufacturer’s warranty

By designing our products in the field, with heat, cold, rain, snow, dust, mud, and wind in mind, (tested in the potential extreme weather conditions faced while hunting) SportDog has become one of the most recognized brand in the electronic tracking and training categories, making the promise to always create "Gear The Way You'd Design It".
feature_bullets: Easy-to-install containment kit includes everything needed to cover 1 1/3 acres of land for one dog; can be expanded to cover 100 acres with more wire and flags (sdf-wf)
Waterproof collar takes standard 9-volt battery (included) that lasts 6-12 months; Fits dogs 10 pound And up
Contain an unlimited number of dogs with additional collars (sdf-r)
Collar gives Tone (beep) and vibration (Buzz) warning before moving to one of four static stimulation levels (you choose the best level for your dog)
Transmitter features wire break alarm and built in Lightning Protector
Includes two-year manufacturer’s warranty; Call our US-based customer care Center for support

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
